channel.title: How to make a server 24/7?
channel.description:
How do you make a server 24/7?
I am currently using no-ip and i need to keep no-ip logged in and the "run" in the source open so people can connect
So how do i make it 24/7? so i can switch off my comp and still have the server up?

item.title: How to make a server 24/7?
item.dc:creator: @crimsonbow13 crimsonbow13
item.description:
@crimsonbow13 wrote:

Cheapest VPS I’ve seen is the one at that www.vpsland.com, $18/month.

Read full topic

item.title: How to make a server 24/7?
item.dc:creator: @Coldkill Coldkill
item.description:
@Coldkill wrote:

The thing is im having problems port forwarding so if vps is already port forwarded then it would be a big time saver…

But i looked at the site given in the second reply…and tbh its confusing

It says windows 2003 and 2008 and linux packages… how do i know what 1 to pick

And how would i get my server on it if i did pick it? do i just upload my source to the vps or something?

Read full topic

item.description:
@0wn3r_k4t3 wrote:

VPS means virtual private server. if yu buy oone im pretty sure its already port forwarded. i jus use my friends and all we hadda do is get no-ip

item.title: How to make a server 24/7?

item.title: How to make a server 24/7?
item.dc:creator: @Coldkill Coldkill
item.description:
@Coldkill wrote:

[quote=“Pure Demons, post:3, topic:325093”][quote author=crimsonbow13 link=topic=421438.msg3095065#msg3095065 date=1263215084]
That is completely IMPOSSIBLE. People play on your server because they’re running off of ‘your’ computer. If you turn it off, off goes the server. When a computer is off, everything on the computer doesn’t exist. Because it needs power to piece things together. You can get a different hoster tho. Sometimes costs money, so I advise using a friends computer :] GL
[/quote]

Impossible? It’s called a VPS, try http://www.vpsland.com. There are MANY VPS sites offering cheap hosting.[/quote]

i heard about these…but how would i set it up and what does it do?

Does this also stop the need for port forwarding?

does it putmy source on another computer or something? Because it says stuff like “windows 2003 plans” and “windows 2008 plans” and “linux plans” what are these for?

Read full topic

item.title: How to make a server 24/7?
item.dc:creator: @Pure_Demons Pure Demons
item.description:
@Pure_Demons wrote:

crimsonbow13:

That is completely IMPOSSIBLE. People play on your server because they’re running off of ‘your’ computer. If you turn it off, off goes the server. When a computer is off, everything on the computer doesn’t exist. Because it needs power to piece things together. You can get a different hoster tho. Sometimes costs money, so I advise using a friends computer :] GL

Impossible? It’s called a VPS, try http://www.vpsland.com. There are MANY VPS sites offering cheap hosting.

Read full topic
